entry.title: Metallica
entry.content: Metallica is an American heavy metal band based in San Rafael, California. The band was formed in 1981 in Los Angeles when vocalist/guitarist James Hetfield responded to an advertisement posted by drummer Lars Ulrich in a local newspaper.
entry.summary: Metallica is an American heavy metal band based in San Rafael, California. The band was formed in 1981 in Los Angeles when vocalist/guitarist James Hetfield responded to an advertisement posted by drummer Lars Ulrich in a local newspaper.

entry.title: WILLIE NELSON & FAMILY
entry.content:
With a six-decade career and 200 plus albums, this iconic Texan is the creative genius behind the historic recordings of “Crazy,” “Red Headed Stranger,” and “Stardust.” Willie Nelson has earned every conceivable award as a musician and amassed reputable credentials as an author, actor, and activist. He continues to thrive as a relevant and progressive musical and cultural force. In the last five years alone he delivered nine new album releases (of which one resulted in a Grammy Award win), released a Top 10 New York Times’ bestsellers book, headlined “Farm Aid,” an event he co-founded in 1985, and graced the cover of Rolling Stone magazine.

More Information: Willie Nelson Bio
entry.summary:
With a six-decade career and 200 plus albums, this iconic Texan is the creative genius behind the historic recordings of “Crazy,” “Red Headed Stranger,” and “Stardust.” Willie Nelson has earned every conceivable award as a musician and amassed reputable credentials as an author, actor, and activist. He continues to thrive as a relevant and progressive musical and cultural force. entry.title: SPY HOP PRESENTS: HEATWAVE FESTIVAL
entry.content:
Thanks for attending SpyHop's Heatwave Festival this year!
Check back next spring for the date of their 2017 event!

Heatwave Festival is Spy Hop's annual music festival that celebrates the success of their year-long Loud & Clear Audio Programs.

Over the year, the participants in each Spy Hop Audio Program, Musicology and Loud & Clear Youth Radio work hard to produce music, radio plays, and perform live shows.

Spy Hop’s Heatwave Festival showcases the next generation of musical, radio, and music business professionals from Spy Hop’s Loud & Clear Audio Programs.

Bring a picnic and join music and radio industry professionals, students, friends, and families to celebrate Spy Hop's Audio Programs accomplishments over the year.

For more information please visit Spy Hop's website:
http://spyhop.org/heatwave-festival
entry.summary: Thanks for attending SpyHop's Heatwave Festival this year! Check back next spring for the date of their 2017 event!

entry.title: SUNDANCE INSTITUTE SUMMER FILM SERIES
entry.content:
Photo Credit: Fred Hayes

FREE outdoor community screenings in the Red Butte Garden Amphitheatre. Pack a blanket and a picnic, low-back chairs, and bring your friends to enjoy Sundance Film Festival favorites under the stars. It can get chilly at night, so come prepared.

Gates open at 7:30PM and movies begin at dusk. Please enter through the Amphitheatre gates. All films go on rain or shine (pending lightening). All screenings are Free, no ticket needed.

THANK YOU FOR MAKING THE 2016 FILM SERIES A SUCCESS!
Check back next spring for the 2017 movie lineup.

www.sundance.org/utah
Step into the world of the Sundance Institute Artist Programs.
These events are FREE and open to the public.

entry.title: FREE HORTICULTURE SPOTLIGHT LECTURE SERIES
entry.content:
Thank you for attending the 2016 Horticulture Spotlight Lecture Series.
Check back next spring for the 2017 Lecture Series dates and topics.

Utah State University Salt Lake County Extension

2016 Horticulture Spotlight Lecture Series


All lectures from 6:30 - 7:30PM

Lectures are Free but registration with USU Extension is required.

Broadening the Research Mission of the Conservation Department at Red Butte Garden

Monday, May 16
Presenter: Bruce Pavlik, Red Butte Garden Conservation Director

Promoting Managed Pollinator Health Along the Wasatch Front

Monday, June 20
Presenter: Joey Caputo, Utah Department of Agriculture and Food (UDAF)

Organic Weed Control

Monday, July 18
Presenter: Katie Wagner, USU Extension Salt Lake County


Rain Water Harvesting for the Urban Landscape

Monday, August 15
Presenter: Ellen Bailey, USU Extension Water Quality

Localscapes- Landscape Design Made Simple

Monday, September 19
Presenter: Cynthia Bee, Jordan Valley Conservation Garden Park
entry.summary: Thank you for attending the 2016 Horticulture Spotlight Lecture Series. Check back next spring for the 2017 Lecture Series dates and topics.

entry.title: Garden Poetry Reading
entry.content:
Go on a walk through the Garden with the winners of our spring poetry contest! Throughout the month of April the Garden is hosting 11 poetry boxes showcasing works from contemporary poets in honor of National Poetry Month. Visit a handful of these poems to hear live readings and gain details about the meaning behind the words, direct from the poets themselves.

Authors in attendance will include:

  • Louise Cook
  • Star Coulbrooke
  • Lee Pelham Cotton
  • Christina Elizabeth
  • Julie Chytraus
  • Katharine Goodman
  • Jose Knighton
  • Caridad Woltz
  • Kristen Norton
  • Markay Brown
  • Bodi Marzka

REGISTRATION REQUIRED
entry.summary: Go on a walk through the Garden with the winners of our spring poetry contest! Throughout the month of April the Garden is hosting 11 poetry boxes showcasing works from contemporary poets in honor of National Poetry Month. Visit a handful of these poems to hear live readings and gain details about the meaning behind the words, direct from the poets themselves.
